intro: Malouetia flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered malouetia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other ornamental and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its attractive flowers and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and as a ornamental plant.
